comments.commentBody: "The Highest Rated Host"  and they let him go?!  What are they crazy?....all the shows that follow Countdown are part of the ripple effect that Keith initiates. I don't understand why a liberal with fire in his belly is taken with such caution considering the volume of the conservative noise machine. This is a grave error that I only hope does not silence an important liberal icon. And Comcast if this is your doing, then you're turning your new toy into a hot potato.  Miss you already Keith..please come back.
I hate Comcast!  I am switching to Direct next week.

This MUST be a joke!  Kieth Olbermann is not only a good point-counter-point to that disingenuous FOX network, but quite brilliant to boot.  He has always been the real core and heart of MSNBC to me!  Funny, quick, and smart..quite a combination!  He was the first to boost Rachel Maddow, with no qualms about his own ratings.  I always found Kieth to be a real gentleman who always spoke the truth, and was quick to point out when he was wrong. FOX gets away with lies and more!  Who now will point out what "mistakes" are made by Beck, Limbaugh, O'Reilley, and Fox and Friends?  It makes sense that FOX has Roger Ailes and Rupert Murdoch!  At least MSNBC has HONEST brokers at the helm.  Who did you give money to over there at FOX?????  How about some transparency!  I hope Chris, Ed, Rachel, and Laurence need not fear to speak the truth!  FOX, Saturday Night Live's still got your number!  Good Luck Kieth, I'll Miss you!  ;>(((

Keith Was awesome on ESPN and at time un-watchable on MSNBC. Hopefully he takes his show to fox and then things will get interesting.

He is entertaining and his wit is second to none!
Maybe Keith and Rachel and others should get together with Opra and see if they can start a progressive political leg of OWN

Folks who think Comcast is behind it may be right, but it certainly isn't because Comcast is a conservative company.  I live in the Phila area and the Comcast execs are about as liberal as corporations come....Now -- it is a business decision based on programming?  That I don't know.  But give it a rest folks.  Keith combined ESPN cadence with moral outrage to generate blind loyalty.

Does anyone else suspect that Comcast is going to turn MSNBC into a clone of FOX News? It's not as if MSNBC was truly leftist, more milquetoast at best - but even weak liberalism angers our plutocratic masters. The Koch Brothers and Rupert Murdoch don't care for mere mortals to get ideas above their station...

One is sorry to see Keith Olbermann leave MSNBC. Mr. Olbermann was a politiical voice balance in the American world of cultural disputes. MSNBC Management has lost more than it gain with Olbermann's departure. It is certain that Keith Olbermann in time will find a a better forum to report and comment from than commericial cable television that is govern by the whims of wealthy corporate financed lobbyists. Keith Olbermann is an intelligent man who will find his way around current contract restrictions to return as an important voice in the realm of moral ideas in spite of the cultural firestorm that is being promoted by the Right mis-identified as "Conseravatives'.

Michael Fay,
College Station, Texas
The worsest person in the world?  Comcast.

I will certainly miss Countdown with Keith.  At this point I will not abandon MSNBC.  It still has Rachel, Lawrence, and Chris.  I've a wait and see attitude as to how the Comcast takeover will affect the network.
I'm betting this is less about Comcast than about Immelt's new position on Obama's Economic Council and Keith wanting to criticize it.
comcast/nbc--you lose.

I am somewhat surprised to hear this after not watching the show tonight. Had I watched the announcement, I likely would have been stunned. I hope that Olbermann will land somewhere where those of us who appreciated his heartfelt commentary can continue to view and hear from him. I believe he has enough of a following that this abrupt departure will not be a defeat. One door clses and another door opens. With the recent purchase of the network and corporate irresponsibility, I am however not totally surprised. Something stinks (is STANK) at MSNBC. So, I will be patient. IT AIN'T OVER. Principle will beat profits. And when Olbermann returns, he'll be as crisp and fresher than ever!
No more msnbc for me.   Hope Keith will turn up somewhere else.
Keith:  please run for president.

I already decided never to watch MSNBC again, and it was the only opinion TV station I watched. I am making plans to cancel Comcast as well for my television and Internet. It is clear that Comcast pushed the idiots at MSNBC to firing Keith. It won't be long until Ed and Rachel are fired. They can go back to radio where I will continue to listen to Ed when I get the chance.
Sorry to see Keith leave, he is my favorite and I will miss his honest and logical commentary. Whatever he does in the future, I will be watching and listening.

So the corporations are closing the deal on "Buying America" - they own the Supreme Court, The House, Some of the Senate, The News Media and are working on the internet.

And to think the 2nd amendment folks wasted their money on guns they should have just sold out. Guns will not stop what is happening today.

Best of luck Keith at least you still have some of their money.
comcast has earned my everlasting enmity

In the darkest days of the Bush Administration, when I was afraid to comment, as I'm doing now, publicly, on political matters, Mr. Olbermann had the courage to speak up.  For that, I will always deeply respect and admire him.  And miss him terribly, even when his Thurber readings grew tiresome.
There is much less reason to watch TV tomorrow. I won't watch rightwing lies and the other brainless entertainment news.
I am done with msnbc. They have gone to the dark side. Good luck Rachel.

Absolutely the best commentator on cable tv.  Someone had to effectively challenge the moronic positions taken continuously on Fox Spews.  Unfortunately, we all know that half the people have an IQ above 100 and half have an IQ below 100.  Fox takes advantage of the ignorant  to convince them that no taxes on billionaires will help them, whereas in fact where we are heading is to a virtual slavery as the minimum wage is abolished and unemployment insurance is ending, forcing people to work for $2 an hour so they don't starve.  Guess they'll probably start up the company store concept again so that everyone is always in debt to the rich "job creators" who create so many jobs in Viet Nam that the whole economy is depending on those billionaires.  Keith, how could you have left this position with a contractual barrier to your re-entering this incredibly important post.
Very sad. I'm in shock. Keith, please return soon.

Keith is an important voice for those of us who need more analysis on news stories.  He isn't a news reader.  He is a bright, engaging analyst.  This sudden departure reeks of nothing good and it is my hope that the  real story will come out in the near future.   He is a necessary adjunct to the evening news which lacks analysis.
